sect1.title: Administrative Interface
sect1.para: The interface for the EdgeReports Appliance is presented as three tabs. The first tab, ,is a convienence which launches a web browser to view the current set of reports. The second tab, ,is used to provide a list of administrators who will receive daily report summaries via emai. The last tab, ,is used to provide host names for IP addresses.

sect2.title: View Reports
sect2.para: This tab is simply a convienence to launch a web browser to view the current set of reports.

note.para: For security reasons, Administrators connected via monitor directly to the ⪚ cannot launch a browser.

sect2.title: Email Report Recipients
sect2.para: The Email Report tab, as shown in , lets Administrators provide a list of email addresses which should receive daily report summaries by email.

sect2.title: IP Address to User Map
sect2.para: The IP Addres to User Map tab, as shown in enhances the readability of reports for deployments with static IP addresses.

figure.title: IP Address to User Map Tab

sect2.para: This applies for addresses in reports. For external addresses (addresses outside the protected network), it is unlikely that you could (or should) configure all IP addresses. However, for internal (protected) addresses configuring this panel makes reports more readable.
If you are using DHCP, as discussed in , then you do not have to configure this tab.

question.para: I'm not getting reports, yet I added my email address to the email list as shown in ?

answer.para: First, be aware that reports are sent on a daily basis. You may have to wait up to 24 hours to receive your first report
If you have had the system configured for more than 24 hours, the most likely cause is an issue with the global email settings. Please refer to for help on these settings.
